name: Tremadog
description: Legendary crag above Porthmadog. Superb steep routes on perfect rock. Vector and One Step in the Clouds are UK classics. Can be greasy when humid. Café at base.

name: Gogarth
description: Wales's premier sea cliff. Atmospheric, adventurous, serious. North Stack Wall is world-class. Check tides, bring helmets, expect adventure. Not for the faint-hearted.

name: Llanberis Pass
description: The classic Welsh climbing venue. Dinas Cromlech with Cenotaph Corner. Clogwyn y Grochan. Extreme history, extreme routes. Limited parking - arrive early.

name: Dinorwig Slate Quarries
description: Unique quarry climbing on angular slate. Rainbow Slab area is incredible. Dries fast but beware sharp edges. Industrial archaeology meets vertical dance.

name: Pembroke
description: Huge area of sea cliffs with everything from gentle slabs to overhanging nightmares. Stackpole and Bosherston for easier routes. St Govans for hardcore. Tidal access on some.

name: Pen Trwyn (Great Orme)
description: Premier Welsh sport crag. Steep limestone with pockets and tufas. Lower Pen Trwyn good for warming up. Upper tier serious. Marine Drive access.

name: Llanbradach Quarry
description: Sheltered quarry with good sport routes. Quick drying. Popular with learners and mid-grade climbers. Short approach from car park.

name: Ogmore
description: Roadside sea cliffs with accessible trad routes. Good for learning to lead. Check tides for lower routes. Stepping stones across river.

name: Clogwyn Du'r Arddu
description: The Black Cliff - Britain's most serious mountain crag. Routes like Great Wall and Vember are legendary. Alpine atmosphere. Experienced parties only. Slow to dry.

name: Rhoscolyn
description: Hidden gem with friendly routes and great position. Good for learning sea cliff skills. Check tides for lower areas. Respect access - sensitive area.

name: Craig y Forwyn
description: Popular sport crag near Llandudno. Quick drying limestone. Good grades for progression. Can be busy but friendly atmosphere.

name: Cilan Head
description: Exposed granite sea cliffs with adventurous routes. Remote setting on Llŷn Peninsula. Check tides and weather. Proper adventure climbing.
